segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image

segment.source: How to Update a MED-V Image
segment.target: How to Update a MED-V Image

segment.source: An existing MED-V image can be updated, thereby creating a new version of the image.
segment.target: An existing MED-V image can be updated, thereby creating a new version of the image.

segment.source: The new version can then be deployed on client computers, replacing the existing image.
segment.target: The new version can then be deployed on client computers, replacing the existing image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: When a new version is deployed on the client, it overwrites the existing image.
segment.target: When a new version is deployed on the client, it overwrites the existing image.

segment.source: When updating an image, ensure that no data on the client needs to be saved.
segment.target: When updating an image, ensure that no data on the client needs to be saved.

segment.source: To update a MED-V image
segment.target: To update a MED-V image

segment.source: Open the existing image in Virtual PC 2007.
segment.target: Open the existing image in Virtual PC 2007.

segment.source: Make the required changes to the image, updating the image (such as installing new software).
segment.target: Make the required changes to the image, updating the image (such as installing new software).

segment.source: Close Virtual PC 2007.
segment.target: Close Virtual PC 2007.

segment.source: Test the image.
segment.target: Test the image.

segment.source: After the image is tested, pack it to the local repository, using the same name as the existing image.
segment.target: After the image is tested, pack it to the local repository, using the same name as the existing image.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you name the image a different name than the existing version, a new image will be created rather than a new version of the existing image.
segment.target: If you name the image a different name than the existing version, a new image will be created rather than a new version of the existing image.

segment.source: Upload the new version to the server or distribute it via a deployment package.
segment.target: Upload the new version to the server or distribute it via a deployment package.
